intro: Melampyrum subalpinum, commonly known as alpine touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or reddish, with a distinctive two-lipped structure that attracts pollinators such as bees and flies. Melampyrum subalpinum is known for its ability to survive in harsh environments, making it a notable species in high-altitude ecosystems.
